title: Remarks on the determination of the Lorentzian metric by the length of geodesics. (arXiv:2208.01842v3 [math.AP] UPDATED)
description:
We consider a Lorentzian metric in $\R\times\R^n$. We show that if we know the lengths of space-time geodesics starting at $(0,y,\eta)$ when $t=0$, then we can recover the metric.

We also prove the rigidity of Lorentzian metrics.
dc:creator: Gregory Eskin
